an6.98:4.1: “Mendicants, it’s totally impossible for a mendicant who regards any condition as permanent to accept views that agree with the teaching.
an6.98:4.2: Without accepting views that agree with the teaching, it’s impossible to arrive at certainty regarding the right path.
an6.98:4.3: Without arriving at certainty regarding the right path, it’s impossible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.
an6.98:5.1: It’s totally possible for a mendicant who regards all conditions as impermanent to accept views that agree with the teaching.
an6.98:5.2: Having accepted views that agree with the teaching, it’s possible to arrive at certainty regarding the right path.
an6.98:5.3: Having arrived at certainty regarding the right path, it’s possible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.”
